introduction.p: This project will serve to introduce you to several important coding structures in the Sage language.

sage.input:
def bisection(f,a,b,delta=10^-6): w = b-a r = ceil(log(w/delta, 2)) m = [(a+b)/2] a, b = [a],[b] for i in range(r): if f(m[-1]) == 0: break elif f(m[-1]) > 0: a.append(a[-1]) b.append(m[-1]) elif f(m[-1]) < 0: a.append(m[-1]) b.append(b[-1]) m.append( (a[-1]+b[-1])/2 ) return a,b,m
x = var('x') f(x) = 3-x^2 a,b,m = bisection(f,0,4) print m[-1]
